Nemešovi utisci posle bronze u Vuhanu: Bolje nego na OI u Riju
“Kompletna organizacija koštala je čak 23 miliona dolara. Izgradili su selo za smeštaj 9.300 sportista koje je bilo neuporedivo bolje, funkcionalnije i modernije od onog koje smo imali na Olimpijskim igrama u Riju“

01 Nov 2019

Trofejni srpski rvač Viktor Nemeš nedavno se vratio iz Kine gde je na Svetskim vojnim igrama osvojio još jednu medalju za našu zemlju - ovog puta bronzanu. Prvi slobodan trenutak ovaj vrhunski sportista iz Sente iskoristio je da obavi sve formalnosti oko upisa na četvrtu godinu Fakulteta za sport, koji i pored brojnih sportskih obaveza uspešno pohađa.
Zanimljivo je da je od 2016. godine, od kada je postao stipendista Fakulteta za sport Univerziteta "Union - Nikola Tesla" Nemeš osvojio čak pet medalja - zlato i bronzu na šampionatima sveta, srebro i bronzu na evropskim prvenstvima i sada bronzu u Vuhanu i tako na najbolji mogući način pokazao kako vrhunska sportska karijera i visoko obrazovanje mogu da idu ruku pod ruku.
Iz kineskog grada Vuhan, hiljadu kilometara južno od Pekinga, sa Svetskih vojnih igara na kojima je prvi put učestvovao, Nemeš se vratio pun utisaka. "Organizacija je bila na vrhunskom nivou. Bio sam zadivljen onim što sam video. Kinezi su to odradili na maestralan način, a dovoljno je možda samo reći da je kompletna organizacija koštala čak 23 miliona dolara. Izgradili su selo za smeštaj 9.300 sportista koje je bilo neuporedivo bolje, funkcionalnije i modernije od onog koje smo imali na Olimpijskim igrama u Riju. Bilo je angažovano čak 25.000 volontera, na otvaranju igara pevao je slavni glumac Džeki Čen, a toj svečanoj ceremoniji prisustvoao je i predsednik Kine Si Đinping. Kada smo dolazili u Kinu i kada smo se vraćali u Srbiju, na aerdromima smo imali povlašćen status, imali smo poseban protokol, nismo čekali u redovima niti se bilo gde zadržavali. Uz nas je bio uvek neko iz organizacije i lokalni policijski službenik, tako je bilo u Kini, ali i na aerdromima u Minsku i Budimpešti. Zaista neverovatno", rekao je Nemeš.
Kada je o samom takmičenju reč, Nemeš je istakao:"Konkurencija je bila izuzetno jaka. Dovoljno je reći samo da sam u polufinalu izgubio od olimpijskog šampiona Hasana Alijeva iz Azerbejdžana. Međutim, u borbi za treće mesto pobedio sam Ukrajinca koga sam savladao i 2015. godine kada sam osvojio svoju prvu medalju u seniorskoj konkurenciji. Zanimljivo je da od njega nikad nisam izgubio, a već smo radili pet ili šest mečeva". 



Ono što predstoji Nemešu su evropske kvalifikacije za plasman na Olimpijske igre."Na šampionatu sveta u Kazahstanu nisam uspeo da izborim olimpjsku vizu što mi je bio osnovni cilj. Međutim, bio sam žestoko oštećen od strane sudija u duelu sa domaćim rvačem. Bilo je nekoliko odluka na moju štetu, evidentnih grešaka za koje ne znam da li su bile sa namerom, ali predsednik Svetske rvačke federacije Nenad Lalović mi je sopštio da taj sudija više neće biti delegiran za velika takmičenja. To mi nije neka satisfakcija, ali šta da se radi i to je sport", napravio je malu digresiju Nemeš i potom se vratio na temu:"Evropske kvalifikacije će biti u martu u Budimpešti. Konkurencija će biti žestoka, jer su do sada samo trojica rvača iz Evrope plasirala na Olimpijske igre, a samo će finalisti obezbediti vizu za Tokio. Reći ću samo da će se u Budimpešti, između ostalih, takmičiti i Roman Vlasov, dvostruki olimpijski šampion".
Pripreme za ovo važno takmičenje Nemeš počinje već početkom decembra."Treniraćemo u bugarskom Belmekenu i tamo ćemo sprovesti bazične pripreme. Potrudiću se da pripreme odradim na najbolji mogući način i već u martu obezbedim Olimpijsku vizu. U suprotnom imaću još jednu šansu u aprilu na svetskim kvalifikacijama", kaže Nemeš i otkriva da za pripreme ima specijalnog aduta u rukavu:"To je znanje za medalje koje stičem na Fakultetu za sport. Na studijskom programu sam Trener u sportu i teorisjko znanje koje stičem svakodnevno proverama u praksi i to mi zaista mnog znači. Već sam mnogo toga naučio, ali pre svega kako da na pravi način osluškujem svoje telo i na osnovu toga kako da pravilno doziram trening. U teoriji sportskog treninga postoji princip svesnosti, po kome sportista treba da zna šta radi, zašto to na treningu radi i kako treba radi. Mislim da sam to dobro izučio i da mi zaista pomaže", zaključio je Nemeš.

Nemesh Impressions After Bronze in Wuhan: Better than the Rio Olympics
"The entire organization cost as much as $ 23 million. They built a village to house 9,300 athletes that was far better, more functional and modern than the one we had at the Rio Olympics. "

01 Nov 2019

Trophy Serbian wrestler Viktor Nemesh recently returned from China to win another medal for our country at the World War Games - this time a bronze. The first free moment was used by this top athlete from Senta to complete all the formalities for enrollment in the fourth year of the Faculty of Sport, which despite numerous sports commitments.
It is interesting that since 2016, since becoming a scholarship holder of the Faculty of Sports of the Union - Nikola Tesla University, Nemesh has won as many as five medals - gold and bronze at world championships, silver and bronze at European championships and now bronze in Vuhan and so demonstrated to the best of his ability a top sports career and higher education can go hand in hand.
From the Chinese city of Wuhan, a thousand kilometers south of Beijing, from the World War Games he first participated in, Neshesh is back full of impressions. "The organization was top notch. I was amazed at what I saw. The Chinese did it in a masterful way, and it is enough to say that the entire organization cost as much as $ 23 million. They built a village to house the 9,300 athletes that were far better, more functional and modern than the one we had at the Rio Olympics, as many as 25,000 volunteers were engaged, famous actor Jackie Chen sang at the opening of the Games, and Chinese President Xi Jinping attended the ceremony. China and when we were returning to Serbia, we had privileged status at the airfields, we had a special protocol, we did not wait in queues or linger anywhere.Always there was someone from the organization and a local police officer, so it was in China. but also at the airports in Minsk and Budapest. It's really amazing, "Nemesh said.
Speaking about the competition itself, Nemesh said: "The competition was extremely fierce. Suffice it to say that I lost to Olympic champion Hassan Aliyev of Azerbaijan in the semifinals. However, in the fight for third place, I defeated the Ukrainian, whom I overcame in 2015 "The year I won my first medal in the senior competition. It's interesting that I've never lost one, and we've already done five or six matches."



What lies ahead for Nemes are European qualifications for the Olympic Games. "At the World Championships in Kazakhstan, I was unable to obtain an Olympic visa, which was my primary goal. However, I was severely damaged by the judges in a match with a domestic wrestler. decisions to my detriment, obvious mistakes that I don't know if they were intended, but the president of the World Wrestling Federation, Nenad Lalovic, told me that that judge would no longer be delegated to major competitions, which is not my pleasure, but what to do and this is a sport, "he made a small digression of Nemes and then returned to the topic:" The European qualifications will be in Budapest in March. The competition will be fierce, because so far only three wrestlers from Europe have entered the Olympic Games, and only the finalists will secure a visa for Tokyo. I will only say that Roman Vlasov, a two-time Olympic champion, will compete in Budapest, among others. "
Preparations for this important competition You will not start as early as December. "We will train in Belmeken in Bulgaria and we will make basic preparations there. I will do my best to prepare the preparations in the best way possible and already have an Olympic visa in March. Otherwise I will have another chance in April at the World qualifications, "says Nemes, and reveals that he has a special trump card up his sleeve:" That's the knowledge for the medals I get at the Faculty of Sport. I'm a Coach in Sports at the study program and the theoretical knowledge I get in practice every day I have already learned a lot, but first of all, how to listen to my body in the right way and how to dosage training properly. In sports training theory, there is a principle of awareness by which an athlete should know what he is doing, why he is training. it works and it should work. I think I learned it well and that it really helps me, "Nemesh concluded.
